acidbluebriggs wrote:
> Has there been any data collected to help estimate how many Heritrix
> instances can be started, and subsequently crawling, within a single
> JVM with some arbitrary amount of RAM?
> 
> The reason I am asking is that I use Heritrix to crawl one domain per
> order.xml.  So, I am just trying to estimate how many concurrent,
> single domain crawls, I can run.  
> 
> Any ideas?

We have no rules-of-thumb and don't crawl this way at IA, so don't have 
much guidance to offer.

The main thing to watch out for is the way the BDB-JE environment -- of 
which there is one created per crawl -- by default takes 60% of heap 
space. Obviously, you can't have 2 of those (120%) in one JVM, so 
definitely set that value much lower for crawls in the same JVM.

Otherwise, a narrow crawl that stays on just 1 (or a couple of related) 
small sites shouldn't need much in the way of either worker threads or 
memory. It's plausible that you could run dozens inside a 2GB heap, so 
it's worth a try.

- Gordon @ IA
